snippet: The data for October, on industrial production and retail sales, fixed-asset investment and electricity generation, were stronger than most economists had anticipated.
abstract: Chinese economy grew faster than expected in October even as inflation slowed, as government continues heavy lending through its state-owned banks to rekindle growth.

byline.contributor:
Hilda Wang contributed reporting
from Hong Kong. Patrick Zuo contributed
research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: The data for October, on industrial production and retail sales, fixed-asset investment and electricity generation, were stronger than most economists had anticipated.

headline.main: Heavy Lending Creates a Surge in Chinese Economy
headline.print_headline: Fueled by Debt, a Recovery Takes Hold in China
